speaker: Skyline
text: Lights come on in various buildings._   [_Scene 1 - A small specialty foods store.  Frasier and Niles walk in._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, uh, get a cart.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, could you get it, Niles, please?  They're so small they make me feel like I'm some sort of fairy tale giant.  [_Niles gets a cart.  It looks like a child's toy._]

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, any thoughts about what to serve?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I thought we might serve a house-cured gravlax with cr�me fraiche and a sprig of dill.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, in other words the usual.

speaker: Frasier
text: For your information, Niles, people happen to like it.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, people _like_ animated musicals.  [_NB: I can't let this pass.  I _love_ animated musicals. And both Kelsey and David have done voice parts in animated musicals. So there! - Kelly Dean Hansen_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, honestly.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, look!  Caviar.

speaker: Frasier
text: They haven't had any in ages.  This is just what we need to make our soiree soignee. [_chuckles and examines the caviar_]  Whoa. Good heavens.  It's $100 an ounce.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it must be mis-marked. [_to the owner_] Excuse me!  Is the Beluga really $100 an ounce?

speaker: Robert
text: [_heavy French accent_] Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, isn't that rather a lot to pay?

speaker: Robert
text: To you, yes.  To the fish who gave up her life so that you could spread her unborn children on a cracker, it's not so much.  [_N.B. Francois Giroday reprises his role as Robert from_ [[5.17], _"The Perfect Guy"._](/frasier/transcripts/season_5/episode_17/the_perfect_guy.html)]  [_A man in black, with a leather jacket, approaches them._]

speaker: Petyr
text: [_heavy Russian accent_] You know, the reason for such high prices is the Russian mafia.  They control this market.

speaker: Niles
text: [_stupidly_] The Russian mafia controls Robert's Gourmet Goodies?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_impatient with Niles_] He means the _caviar_ market, you ninny.

speaker: Petyr
text: I have Beluga for sale.  Top quality, fair price.  [_Petyr gestures for them to follow them.  He exits the store. Somewhat surprised, they follow him out to the patio._]

speaker: Petyr
text: [_handing Frasier a card_] The name is Petyr.  I recently arrived on my cousin's ship, the _Caspian Queen_ with beautiful Beluga caviar.  But because of those gangsters, we cannot sell. So I do it like this.  Quietly.  How much you want?

speaker: Frasier
text: How do we know this isn't some sort of scam?

speaker: Petyr
text: It's no scam.  [_He reaches for a bottle inside his coat, and hands it to Frasier._]

speaker: Petyr
text: Look inside.  [_Frasier looks at the caviar, stunned.  Petyr pulls out a cloth napkin._]

speaker: Petyr
text: You taste!  [_Frasier and Niles each take small spoons from the napkin.  While Frasier samples the caviar, Niles wipes down his spoon with his trusty handkerchief.  Frasier's face expresses that the caviar is divine._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You really must try this, Niles.  [_Niles does so.  His facial expression is equally ecstatic.  Petyr gives them a questioning look._]

speaker: Niles
text: It's like being kissed by a lusty mermaid!  [_Petyr takes back the spoons.  Niles is still licking his as it is taken._]

speaker: Petyr
text: So, you are interested, yes?

speaker: Frasier
text: Maybe, but how can we be sure that you are not Russian mafia yourself?

speaker: Petyr
text: [_gravely_] Because for six generations my family fished the Caspian. Then ten years ago, the bastards come.  They burn my father's boat. [_with increasing passion_] They steal my mother's salt so she cannot prepare the roe.  And if they know I sell Beluga for $40 an ounce!  They would cut out my tongue and pluck out my eyes!

speaker: Niles
text: Did you say $40 an ounce?  [_Petyr nods and smiles.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 2 - Frasier's apartment. Daphne is preparing the table.  Niles is pacing.  Frasier is also waiting._]

speaker: Niles
text: Shouldn't our caviar be here by now?

speaker: Frasier
text: It'll be here, Niles, I gave Roz explicit instructions.

speaker: Niles
text: What if we've been swindled?  What if the tins are filled with sand?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I am, as you know, an excellent judge of character.  And in Petyr, I saw an honest, hard-working fisherman.

speaker: Daphne
text: Why didn't you have him deliver it here?

speaker: Frasier
text: What?  I don't want him knowing where I live!  [_The doorbell rings.  Frasier answers.  Roz is wearing sunglasses._]

speaker: Roz
text: The Russian bear hunts by night!

speaker: Frasier
text: Very funny, Roz, come on.  Give me that. [_She hands him a small insulated cooler._] All right, let's have a look.  [_He opens the cooler and grabs a tin.  He and Niles look at it and speak with awe and wonder._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_whispering in awe_] Oh!  Niles!  [_Niles swoons.  Frasier beams._]

speaker: Daphne
text: It's beautiful.

speaker: Roz
text: I don't get what the big deal is about caviar.  I had it once. It was nothing special.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Roz, a lot of things can affect caviar.  Where did you have it?

speaker: Roz
text: On a mini-bagel at the Tucson Doubletree.  [_Niles immediately offers Roz the tin._]

speaker: Niles
text: Here, try this.

speaker: Roz
text: [_sampling the caviar_] Hmmm.  Wow.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mm-hmm.

speaker: Roz
text: That's good.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Roz
text: That's really good.  What's your little party for tonight?

speaker: Frasier
text: Invited guests.  I'm sorry, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shepherding Roz out the door_] Thank you for your help.  See you later.  [_Martin enters as Roz exits._]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, hey, Roz.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey!  Hey, everybody.  Check this out!  I just went to the ATM for $20, as you can see from this receipt, and it gave me $60. I won 40 bucks!

speaker: Niles
text: You mean the bank lost $40.

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, yeah, that big faceless bank that charges me $12 a month for my checking account lost $40.  [_He hangs up his coat._]

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, you can't keep that.  It's bad karma.

speaker: Martin
text: Sorry.  This is America.  A land built on the principle, "Finders Keepers."

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, come on.  There's a toll-free service number right here on the receipt.  Just call them and tell them what happened.

speaker: Martin
text: Why should I?

speaker: Daphne
text: Because otherwise, you could end up like my brother Nigel and his baby teeth.  [_General silence.  The three Crane men all roll their eyes and look at each other uncomfortably.  After a long pause, Niles takes the inevitable "Daphne family story" bait._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_deadpan_] What happened with your brother Nigel and his baby teeth?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, like any child, the first time he had a tooth fall out he put it under his pillow at bedtime, and sure enough, the next morning he found that Winston Churchill had left him a shiny new coin.

speaker: Martin
text: Question.

speaker: Niles
text: No, Dad, we're not stopping.  Go ahead, Darling.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, instead of being grateful, he got greedy and went off to school, punching people in their mouths and scooping up their teeth. [_Martin reacts to this._] Of course, it didn't work and he got kicked out of school, became a thief, and eventually went to prison.  [_Martin doesn't "get it."  He looks at Frasier, who tries to lead Daphne to the story's "moral."_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Where he... fittingly had all of his teeth knocked out...?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, he lost his teeth years earlier in a rock-eating contest. Now that's an interesting story.  We were renting a house next to a quarry at the time...

speaker: Martin
text: [_unwilling to take any more_] All right, all right, I'll call the bank!  [_He rises.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 3 - Frasier's apartment. The soiree is going very well.  Frasier is speaking to a couple._]

speaker: Mr. Michaels
text: Very kind of you to have us here, Crane.

speaker: Mrs. Michaels
text: Yes, it's wonderful.  But then you must be used to hosting successful parties.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_matter-of-factly_] Oh, not really.  Something's usually on fire by now.

speaker: Mrs. Michaels
text: Oh, you're funny.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I'm serious.

speaker: Mr. Michaels
text: Now, tell me.  How can we get our hands on some of this fantastic caviar?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I wish I could tell you but it's uh... a private source.

speaker: Mr. Michaels
text: Well, perhaps I should mention then that, uh, this is for our yacht party, at which there just might be room enough for another guest.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, what are we talking here?

speaker: Mr. Michaels
text: Well, maybe five, six ounces?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sucking up_] Let me go see what's in the refrigerator.

speaker: Mr. Michaels
text: Thatta boy, Crane!  [_Frasier exits to the kitchen, where Niles is gathering the tins of caviar. Martin is on the phone, in the background._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, what are you doing?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, good news.  Emile Sinclair is crazy about the caviar.  If we sell him the rest, he distinctly implied he could get our squash lockers moved further from the showers.  Isn't that fantastic?

speaker: Martin
text: [_on the phone, enunciating_] Per-son-al.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, it would be, Niles, if the Michaelses weren't equally enamored of it and dangling an invitation to a yacht party.

speaker: Niles
text: [_gasping_] That is a pickle!

speaker: Martin
text: [_to the phone_] Check-ing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, why don't we just call Petyr and order some more caviar? That way we can satisfy both Sinclair and the Michaels.

speaker: Martin
text: Cus-to-mer Ser-vice!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Niles, this caviar connection could really open some doors for us, hmm?

speaker: Martin
text: [_now yelling into the phone_] Per-son-al!

speaker: Niles
text: What you doing, Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, this stupid bank's automated voice system.  It's like a maze!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, give it here. [_taking the phone_] You just push "O," and you'll get an operator.  Little trick I learned.  Another menu, hmm.  Sometimes it's a star. [_He tries it._] All right, maybe "1" will get me back to a main menu.  Ah.  Here you go.

speaker: Martin
text: Got me to the right department?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, but if I remember my high school Spanish correctly, you just qualified for a small-business loan.  [_Martin is frustrated.  He takes the phone.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 4 - Bank lobby. Daphne and Martin approach the counter.  A male teller greets them._]

speaker: Teller
text: Hi, can I help you?

speaker: Martin
text: Yes, uh, I was at one of your ATM's yesterday, and it gave me back more than it should have, so I want to...

speaker: Teller
text: [_interrupting_] Okay, for that you're going to need to complete an ATM trouble report [_producing one_] and then take it to our operations officer at the desk over there.

speaker: Martin
text: You mean I have to fill this out before I can give you 40 bucks?

speaker: Teller
text: Yes, sir.

speaker: Martin
text: But your sign says, "Making banking simpler!"

speaker: Teller
text: Yes, sir.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, this isn't simpler, it's more complicated.

speaker: Teller
text: Yes, sir, it is.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, forget it.  [_He and Daphne leave the counter and walk to a table._]

speaker: Martin
text: I knew this was going to be more trouble than it's worth.

speaker: Daphne
text: A little paperwork's a small price to pay for a clear conscience.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, meanwhile, I'm out 40 bucks.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's not your money!  [_They approach the desk indicated by the teller.  A male officer greets them._]

speaker: Officer
text: Can I help you?

speaker: Martin
text: Yes, uh, I had some trouble with one of your ATM's.

speaker: Officer
text: Oh, I can't help you.  I need a manager.  [_He exits to the rear._]

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm proud of you.  Trust me, when this is over, you'll feel better.

speaker: Martin
text: You really think so?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sure of it.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, maybe you're right.  Maybe I will feel better.  And if you're right about that karma stuff, I got a good thing coming to me.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_looking out the window_] Uh-oh.  How much money did you put in the meter?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, son of a bitch!  [_The bank manager, a woman, enters._]

speaker: Manager
text: Hi, Mr. Crane, I'm Bree, Todd's manager.  I wanted to apologize for the trouble you had with our ATM.  And make sure that you got your $40.  [_She offers him the cash._]

speaker: Martin
text: What, uh, oh, no, no!  You don't need to give anything to me. The machine accidentally gave me $60 instead of $20, so I need to give _you_ $40.

speaker: Manager
text: So, you want to put this in your account?  [_Daphne rolls her eyes._]

speaker: Martin
text: No, no!  I want you to take it, plus this $40, and put it back wherever it came from.

speaker: Manager
text: Well, I'm afraid I've already done the paperwork.  Now, you'll need to speak with our branch manager, and he's out of town.

speaker: Martin
text: This is ridiculous!

speaker: Manager
text: I'm sorry.  Although, there is one other possibility.  Let me try something.

speaker: Martin
text: Thank you.

speaker: Manager
text: Don't mention it.  [_She picks up the phone and dials.  Martin glares at Daphne._]

speaker: Manager
text: [_in the "enunciating" tone previously used by Martin_] Per-son-al.  [_Martin sighs and sinks into a chair.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 5 -- Cafe Nervosa. Frasier and Niles are seated.  Niles is checking "order slips."_]

speaker: Niles
text: Sandoval, four ounces.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Niles
text: Smoot, five ounces.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Niles
text: McBean, ten ounces.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm, ten?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I know it's a lot, but he promised me the use of his Sonoma estate.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, for ten he should.  You know, for eight, the Ashworths gave me the use of their box on the opera's opening night gala.

speaker: Niles
text: But that's the same weekend as the black and white ball?  When are we going to sleep?  [_They laugh cheerily._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Sleep is for people without social lives.  [_They continue to chuckle and clink their coffee cups.  Roz approaches._]

speaker: Roz
text: So, boys, where's my cut?

speaker: Niles
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Frasier
text: I promised her a cut, you see, I was so busy at work taking orders I needed her help.

speaker: Roz
text: You know what it's really good on?  Scrambled eggs.  And pizza. And potato skins!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Roz, welcome to caviar.

speaker: Roz
text: At work, during the show, I'm just sitting there thinking, "Two hours to caviar.  One hour to caviar."  You don't have any on you do you?  [_Frasier and Niles exchange glances._]

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, no, no, we're expecting some momentarily.

speaker: Roz
text: Cool.  You think it'd be good on a cheese Danish?  I think it would.  I'm getting one.  [_She rises.  Petyr approaches the table with a small cooler._]

speaker: Petyr
text: Gentlemen.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Petyr, hello!

speaker: Petyr
text: Yes, hello, but I'm afraid also goodbye.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm, what?

speaker: Niles
text: What-what do you mean, goodbye?

speaker: Petyr
text: All these orders I fill for you, it draws too much attention. It's too risky for me.

speaker: Frasier
text: What-what are you saying, that there's no more caviar?

speaker: Petyr
text: [_placing the cooler on the table_] This is my last delivery.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looking inside frantically_] But this isn't nearly enough!

speaker: Niles
text: We've made commitments to some very powerful people.  If we disappoint them, there's no telling what they might do!

speaker: Petyr
text: They will break legs?  Cut off thumbs?

speaker: Niles
text: Worse!  There'll be gossip.

speaker: Frasier
text: Petyr, please, just one more delivery!

speaker: Petyr
text: [_rising_] I cannot, the danger is too great.  [_He exits._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Petyr! [_gasping_] Dear God!  We're ruined, Niles.  We owe people all over town.

speaker: Niles
text: I know.

speaker: Roz
text: Is some of that mine?  Can I have it now?

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, Roz, I'm terribly sorry.  It seems our supplier is going out of business, and every ounce of this is spoken for.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, that's too bad.  Oh, well, whatever, I was thinking of giving it up, anyway.  Too much salt.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, good girl.  All right, Niles, we can't panic.  I think I may have a plan.

speaker: Niles
text: [_sarcastically_] I like it.

speaker: Frasier
text: We may have to bite the bullet and buy retail.

speaker: Niles
text: Petyr's stuff is much better quality.  Our friends will notice the difference.

speaker: Frasier
text: Not if we cut it with what's left of the good stuff.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, how much is there?

speaker: Frasier
text: There's...  [_He notices the cooler is gone, as is Roz_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz!!  [_They chase after her.  Fade out._]  _END OF ACT I  ACT II_  [_Scene 6 - Robert's Gourmet Shop. Frasier and Niles enter worriedly._]

speaker: Niles
text: This will cost us a fortune.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what else can we do? [_approaching Robert_] Excuse me.  Do you happen to know where we can get [_pausing_] five pounds of Beluga caviar?

speaker: Robert
text: There's not that much Beluga in all of Seattle.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.  [_They move away._]

speaker: Niles
text: What are we going to do?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, just give me a chance to think, Niles.  Ah... What was the name of the boat...

speaker: Niles
text: [_enthusiastically interrupting_] _H.M.S. Bounty!_

speaker: Frasier
text: [_glaring with irritation_] This isn't Trivial Pursuit.  Let me finish!  What was the name of the boat that Petyr said he sailed on?

speaker: Niles
text: _Caspian Queen._

speaker: Frasier
text: Right!  Niles, if we can find that boat, perhaps we can get enough caviar to solve our problem.  [_Roz enters.  Upon seeing them, she quickly spins the other way, but they have already seen her._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: [_emerging_] Hey, what are you guys doing here?

speaker: Niles
text: I think the question is, what are _you_ doing here?

speaker: Roz
text: You know, shopping, for stuff...  [_She pretends to look at the merchandise._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You're looking for more caviar, aren't you?

speaker: Roz
text: Of course I am!  You took all mine!

speaker: Frasier
text: That was _ours!_  You know, Roz, I think you may have a little problem.

speaker: Roz
text: [_desperately_] You're the one with the problem!  Not me.  This is all your fault.  You made me try it.  Now I crave it!  I really hate you!

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, Roz, you know you don't mean that.  Now, come on.  Listen. It's just possible that we may be able to get some more from our old supplier.

speaker: Roz
text: [_excitedly_] Is that true?  Is he right?  I'm sorry I said I hate you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, Roz, it's all right.

speaker: Roz
text: Are you going to get it today?  I love you!  [_She throws her arms around Frasier.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 7 - Frasier's apartment. Martin is ready to relax in his chair.  As he sits, the phone rings. He reluctantly begins to rise, when the doorbell rings.  He falls back in his chair.  Again the phone rings.  He rises and, after indecision, answers the phone._]

speaker: Martin
text: Hello?  Oh, no I'm sorry.  Frasier isn't here.  [_becoming irritated_] Sure you can place an order. [_irritated singsong_] Let me transfer you to that department.  [_The doorbell rings again as Martin is speaking.  He hangs up and opens the door.  It is Daphne, carrying her supplies and the mail._]

speaker: Martin
text: Hi, Daph.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.  The postman gave me your mail.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, thanks.

speaker: Daphne
text: You ready to get stretched?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, you mean we're working out today?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_impatiently_] We work out every day.  [_She begins to set up._]

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I know. [_examining mail_] Oh, postcard from the bank! Uh, "Dear Mr. Crane, we apologize for the inconvenience. We have evaluated your request [_with amazed irritation_] and credited your account $80?!"  [_Scene 8 - Bank lobby. Martin is in line.  Daphne quickly enters._]

speaker: Daphne
text: There's no spaces.  I parked your car in a loading zone.

speaker: Martin
text: No, no, no, just pull around front and wait for me.  This won't take long.

speaker: Daphne
text: You're sure?

speaker: Martin
text: Yes.  And you better get back to the car before Eddie starts to panic.  [_Daphne rushes out.  Martin approaches the counter.  The teller is female._]

speaker: Teller
text: [_cheerily_] Hi!  How can I help _you_ make banking simpler?

speaker: Martin
text: [_agitated_] I'll tell you how you can help me.  I'm going to talk, and you're going to listen, and you're going to do exactly as I ask.

speaker: Teller
text: [_apprehensive_] I think I should go get a manager.

speaker: Martin
text: [_angrily_] No, no managers!

speaker: Teller
text: Oh, but our policy is...

speaker: Martin
text: Now this is real simple and I know you can handle it.  Now what I want you to do is... [_as he speaks, he reaches inside his coat_]

speaker: Guard
text: Hold it right there, Mister!  [_He turns and sees the guard pointing a gun at him.  He quickly raises his hands._]  [_Scene 9 - Bank lobby. Time fade.  Martin and Daphne are seated at the back desk.  Daphne is holding Eddie.  A dignified, bearded gentleman speaks to them._]

speaker: President
text: Mr. Crane, as the president of the bank, I want to assure you that it is not our policy to draw firearms on customers trying to make a deposit.  [_Daphne rolls her eyes and tosses her head back._]

speaker: Martin
text: [_wearily_] It wasn't a deposit.

speaker: President
text: Now, I'm sure that neither of us wants to turn this into a protracted legal battle, so if you would simply sign this non-disclosure agreement here, here, here, and here... [_Martin puts on his eyeglasses._] Our attorneys have authorized me to compensate you for your troubles in the amount of $10,000, which can be credited to your account.  [_Martin and Daphne are stunned._]

speaker: Martin
text: Ten grand?!

speaker: President
text: Plus the $40 from our original mistake.  [_Martin gives Daphne a look, seeking "approval."  She obviously grants it._]

speaker: Martin
text: [_feigning weariness_] Oh, what the hell, I just want to get it over with. [_He signs the forms._]

speaker: President
text: That's wonderful.  Now, is there anything else I can do for you?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_bemused_] Could I open an account?  [_Fade out._]  **THEY CALL HIM VLAD THE IMPORTER**  [_Scene 10 - A dark ship's interior. Frasier calls from above and descends a ladder.  Two Russians sailors are seated, playing chess._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Ahoy?  Ahoy?  Is anyone there? [_He descends into the cabin._]

speaker: Vladimir
text: Who is there?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hello.  I'm Dr. Frasier Crane, and this is my brother, Dr. Niles Crane.  Uh, we're interested in purchasing some Beluga caviar.

speaker: Vladimir
text: This is not a shop.  I have nothing for sale.

speaker: Niles
text: See, let's go.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, Niles, Niles.  This is how the game is played. Maybe he thinks we're Russian mafia.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes, people make that mistake about us all the time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Petyr gave us this card, and told us that this was his cousin's boat.  Are you sure you can't help us?  [_The second sailor takes the card and speaks to Vladimir in Russian. He responds and they laugh heartily.  Frasier and Niles play along and laugh with them._]

speaker: Vladimir
text: How much do you need?

speaker: Frasier
text: Five pounds.  [_Vladimir gives instructions to the other sailor in Russian, who goes to fetch the caviar.  Frasier takes the empty seat._]

speaker: Vladimir
text: $80 an ounce.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we were paying $40.

speaker: Vladimir
text: And now you pay 80.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_attempting to bargain_] 50.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't think you're doing this right.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_glaring at Niles_] 70, that's my final offer!

speaker: Frasier
text: Done!  [_The other sailor approaches with a huge tub of caviar and places it on the table._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I want to taste it first.

speaker: Vladimir
text: Go ahead.  [_Niles has pulled out napkins and tiny spoons, but Frasier simply uses his fingers.  With apprehension, he samples the caviar.  Niles observes._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_relieved and delighted_] That's the stuff.

speaker: Niles
text: That's enough to take care of everyone and still go out on top.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, all right, here's your money.  Pleasure doing business with you.  [_A voice on a loudspeaker is suddenly heard outside._]

speaker: Agent
text: Stop where you are!  U.S. Customs!  [_The Russians frantically scramble out of the cabin.  Frasier and Niles run around in sheer panic._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my God!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, we have to get rid of it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God!  Oh, dear God!  Oh, dear God!  Oh, dear God!

speaker: Niles
text: All right, all right, we have to hide it!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shouting_] No, Niles, you can't hide it!  They're U.S. Customs. That's what they do!  They find things on ships!

speaker: Niles
text: All right.  I know one way to get rid of it.  [_He pulls out his tiny caviar spoon and begins frantically scooping it into his mouth._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_incredulous_] Can I get you a toast point?  Oh, here, for God's sakes.  [_They both begin to scoop caviar into their mouths with their bare hands. They spill it all over the table in the process.  They continue to scoop rapidly as the officer enters the cabin.  When they raise their heads, their faces are covered with black fish eggs, as are their hands._]

speaker: Agent
text: What the hell's all this?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_like a deer in the headlights, his mouth still full_] It's not ours.  We found it.

speaker: Agent
text: What, the caviar?

speaker: Niles
text: [_mouth full_] Is that what this is?

speaker: Agent
text: Relax, we don't care about that.  We're looking for a couple of Russians who've been smuggling DVD's.  [_They indicate the direction the Russians ran.  The officer stares at them for a moment, bemused.  He then recovers himself and rushes out in that direction._]

speaker: Niles
text: My heart is pounding!

speaker: Frasier
text: I was afraid we were going to get arrested.

speaker: Niles
text: What have we become?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know.  We got caught up in a nefarious scheme.  And for what?  A visit to a wine country estate?

speaker: Niles
text: A box at the opera?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dinner at the governor's mansion?  [_A pause._]

speaker: Frasier
text: How much of this do you think we can salvage?

speaker: Niles
text: I don't know, just start scraping.  [_They begin to scrape the caviar off their faces and hands back into the tub.  They also collect what has spilled onto the table.  Fade out._]
